title: A Covenant to Obey God
summary: Leaders and families sign a covenant to follow God's law, honor the Sabbath, support temple worship, and avoid intermarriage with pagan nations. It’s a formal act of dedication to God’s Word and community life.

faq.question: What did the covenant include?
faq.answer: Commitments to obey the Law, avoid pagan practices, and support temple services.

faq.question: Why was this covenant important?
faq.answer: It marked a national return to God’s ways and separation from worldly influence.
